scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You suggested taking a short break and coming back with a fresh perspective. [Monica] agreed, but [Bob] still seems skeptical. After the break, [Bob] says, 'Even with a break, I don't see how we're going to manage this.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. [Monica] adds, 'Yeah, we need a better plan or more resources.' Now, [Bob] crosses his arms and says, 'I'm still not convinced this will work. Maybe we need to rethink everything.' You acknowledged both Monica's and Bob's concerns and proposed a collaborative approach to solve the issue. [Monica] looks worried and says, 'I think we need more direction. What if we can't pull this off?' [Bob] sighs and says, 'We might just be setting ourselves up for failure.' You suggested re-evaluating the plan and inviting Bob's input. [Monica] fidgets with her pen while [Bob] continues to look skeptical. [Monica] says, 'Okay, so where do we start?'
scenes.description: [Bob] sits back in his chair, arms still crossed, and says, 'We need to be realistic. What if we can't do it even with adjustments?'

options.text: Let's focus on the tasks we can control and manage. Bob, if you have specific concerns, now is the time to voice them so we can address them.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the need for control and invited Bob to share his specific concerns, showing high levels of empathy and social skills.

options.text: We need to have faith in our abilities. We've overcome challenges before, and we can do it again if we stay committed.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay committed and have faith in their abilities, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If we find that our adjustments still aren't enough, we can then consider asking for an extension or additional resources. Let's see what we can do first.
options.analysis: You suggested considering an extension or additional resources if needed, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.
